alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Back (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 3:11PM MST until January 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches. Highest amounts in the Park City area and in the Ogden Valley. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Wasatch Back. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A passing cold front will bring a brief period of heavy snow and strong winds late this afternoon into the early evening. A stronger front will bring a period of even heavier snow Wednesday afternoon into early Wednesday evening. Snow squalls will be possible, bringing strong winds and flash freezing conditions. Multiple additional rounds of snow are expected through the weekend.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov.
